Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

𝐂𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨. 34 𝐨𝐟 2025 – 𝐀 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐋𝐏𝐬 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐔𝐀𝐄 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐚𝐱?The Decision released this weekend introduces a comprehensive new framework for Qualifying Limited Partnerships (QLPs). For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

السلام عليكم ورحمة الله ،أنا خريجة بكالوريوس في شبكات الحاسب وأمن البيانات، أبحث عن فرصة عمل بدوام كامل أو جزئي في الخبر أو الدمام، في مجال الشبكات و أمن البيانات أو تقنية المعلومات بشكل عام .خضت تجربة تدريبية كمساعدة في قسم الـ IT لدى شركة للموارد البشرية، مما أتاح لي فرصة تطبيق المعرفة النظرية على أرض الواقع، واكتساب مهارات عملية.أجيد التعامل مع: •	تحميل وتثبيت أنظمة التشغيل والبرامج (سوفت وير) •	بعض أدوات Kali Linux •	أساسيات لغات البرمجة •	تغيير ملحقات الطابعات وأجهزة الكمبيوتر •	تحديث أنظمة التشغيل وصيانتهاأتطلع إلى بيئة عمل محفزة أطور من خلالها مهاراتي وأسهم في تحقيق أهداف الفريق.إذا كانت لديكم أي فرص مناسبة أو نصائح، سأكون ممتنة لمشاركتها معي.I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Networks and Data Security and am currently seeking a full-time or part-time position in Khobar or Dammam within the IT, networking, or cybersecurity field.I have hands-on experience as an IT intern in a human resources company, and my skills include: •	Software and OS installation •	Basic programming knowledge •	Familiarity with Kali Linux tools •	Hardware support (printers and computers) •	System updates and maintenanceI’m eager to grow within a dynamic and professional environment.Any leads or recommendations would be sincerely appreciated.SDAIA | سدايا Elm Company stc Mobily Cisco SAP Oracle hashtag#stc hashtag#mobily hashtag#sdaia hashtag#الخبر hashtag#الدمام hashtag#IT hashtag#أمن_سيبراني hashtag#شبكات hashtag#وظائف_تقنية

'Dubai is a bubble'Not even close.Aa per the UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, Dubai is classified as fair value. Other major cities like Hong Kong, Singapore or London show a much higher risk of a bubble with average price per sq/ft around 2-3x that of Dubai. The growth in Dubai is a master plan, backed by real fundamentals:=> Population and business expansion=> Higher NET yields than nearly every major city => Investor friendly regulations=> Tax free income and 100% foreign ownershipThis isn't a hype driven surge; it's a maturing, global market offering solid tax free returns.(photo from UBS global bubble index)Full article here:https://lnkd.in/d-y8zUr7hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#UBSBubbleIndex hashtag#InvestmentInsights hashtag#PropertyMarket hashtag#CommercialRealEstate

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

𝐂𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨. 34 𝐨𝐟 2025 – 𝐀 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐋𝐏𝐬 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐔𝐀𝐄 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐚𝐱?The Decision released this weekend introduces a comprehensive new framework for Qualifying Limited Partnerships (QLPs). For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

𝐂𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨. 34 𝐨𝐟 2025 – 𝐀 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐋𝐏𝐬 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐔𝐀𝐄 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐚𝐱?The Decision released this weekend introduces a comprehensive new framework for Qualifying Limited Partnerships (QLPs). For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

السلام عليكم ورحمة الله ،أنا خريجة بكالوريوس في شبكات الحاسب وأمن البيانات، أبحث عن فرصة عمل بدوام كامل أو جزئي في الخبر أو الدمام، في مجال الشبكات و أمن البيانات أو تقنية المعلومات بشكل عام .خضت تجربة تدريبية كمساعدة في قسم الـ IT لدى شركة للموارد البشرية، مما أتاح لي فرصة تطبيق المعرفة النظرية على أرض الواقع، واكتساب مهارات عملية.أجيد التعامل مع: •	تحميل وتثبيت أنظمة التشغيل والبرامج (سوفت وير) •	بعض أدوات Kali Linux •	أساسيات لغات البرمجة •	تغيير ملحقات الطابعات وأجهزة الكمبيوتر •	تحديث أنظمة التشغيل وصيانتهاأتطلع إلى بيئة عمل محفزة أطور من خلالها مهاراتي وأسهم في تحقيق أهداف الفريق.إذا كانت لديكم أي فرص مناسبة أو نصائح، سأكون ممتنة لمشاركتها معي.I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Networks and Data Security and am currently seeking a full-time or part-time position in Khobar or Dammam within the IT, networking, or cybersecurity field.I have hands-on experience as an IT intern in a human resources company, and my skills include: •	Software and OS installation •	Basic programming knowledge •	Familiarity with Kali Linux tools •	Hardware support (printers and computers) •	System updates and maintenanceI’m eager to grow within a dynamic and professional environment.Any leads or recommendations would be sincerely appreciated.SDAIA | سدايا Elm Company stc Mobily Cisco SAP Oracle hashtag#stc hashtag#mobily hashtag#sdaia hashtag#الخبر hashtag#الدمام hashtag#IT hashtag#أمن_سيبراني hashtag#شبكات hashtag#وظائف_تقنية

'Dubai is a bubble'Not even close.Aa per the UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, Dubai is classified as fair value. Other major cities like Hong Kong, Singapore or London show a much higher risk of a bubble with average price per sq/ft around 2-3x that of Dubai. The growth in Dubai is a master plan, backed by real fundamentals:=> Population and business expansion=> Higher NET yields than nearly every major city => Investor friendly regulations=> Tax free income and 100% foreign ownershipThis isn't a hype driven surge; it's a maturing, global market offering solid tax free returns.(photo from UBS global bubble index)Full article here:https://lnkd.in/d-y8zUr7hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#UBSBubbleIndex hashtag#InvestmentInsights hashtag#PropertyMarket hashtag#CommercialRealEstate

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

𝐂𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨. 34 𝐨𝐟 2025 – 𝐀 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐋𝐏𝐬 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐔𝐀𝐄 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐚𝐱?The Decision released this weekend introduces a comprehensive new framework for Qualifying Limited Partnerships (QLPs). For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

𝐂𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨. 34 𝐨𝐟 2025 – 𝐀 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐋𝐏𝐬 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐔𝐀𝐄 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐚𝐱?The Decision released this weekend introduces a comprehensive new framework for Qualifying Limited Partnerships (QLPs). For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

السلام عليكم ورحمة الله ،أنا خريجة بكالوريوس في شبكات الحاسب وأمن البيانات، أبحث عن فرصة عمل بدوام كامل أو جزئي في الخبر أو الدمام، في مجال الشبكات و أمن البيانات أو تقنية المعلومات بشكل عام .خضت تجربة تدريبية كمساعدة في قسم الـ IT لدى شركة للموارد البشرية، مما أتاح لي فرصة تطبيق المعرفة النظرية على أرض الواقع، واكتساب مهارات عملية.أجيد التعامل مع: •	تحميل وتثبيت أنظمة التشغيل والبرامج (سوفت وير) •	بعض أدوات Kali Linux •	أساسيات لغات البرمجة •	تغيير ملحقات الطابعات وأجهزة الكمبيوتر •	تحديث أنظمة التشغيل وصيانتهاأتطلع إلى بيئة عمل محفزة أطور من خلالها مهاراتي وأسهم في تحقيق أهداف الفريق.إذا كانت لديكم أي فرص مناسبة أو نصائح، سأكون ممتنة لمشاركتها معي.I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Networks and Data Security and am currently seeking a full-time or part-time position in Khobar or Dammam within the IT, networking, or cybersecurity field.I have hands-on experience as an IT intern in a human resources company, and my skills include: •	Software and OS installation •	Basic programming knowledge •	Familiarity with Kali Linux tools •	Hardware support (printers and computers) •	System updates and maintenanceI’m eager to grow within a dynamic and professional environment.Any leads or recommendations would be sincerely appreciated.SDAIA | سدايا Elm Company stc Mobily Cisco SAP Oracle hashtag#stc hashtag#mobily hashtag#sdaia hashtag#الخبر hashtag#الدمام hashtag#IT hashtag#أمن_سيبراني hashtag#شبكات hashtag#وظائف_تقنية

'Dubai is a bubble'Not even close.Aa per the UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, Dubai is classified as fair value. Other major cities like Hong Kong, Singapore or London show a much higher risk of a bubble with average price per sq/ft around 2-3x that of Dubai. The growth in Dubai is a master plan, backed by real fundamentals:=> Population and business expansion=> Higher NET yields than nearly every major city => Investor friendly regulations=> Tax free income and 100% foreign ownershipThis isn't a hype driven surge; it's a maturing, global market offering solid tax free returns.(photo from UBS global bubble index)Full article here:https://lnkd.in/d-y8zUr7hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#UBSBubbleIndex hashtag#InvestmentInsights hashtag#PropertyMarket hashtag#CommercialRealEstate

🇦🇪 UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates – April 7, 2025 🇦🇪Stay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1️⃣ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals •	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of €750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECD’s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  •	Action Required: •	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your company’s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. •	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  •	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2️⃣ Abu Dhabi’s Measures to Simplify Business Registration •	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  •	Action Required: •	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. •	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. •	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3️⃣ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage •	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  •	Action Required: •	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. •	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. •	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.⸻hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

Username: The Arab Investment CompanyThe Arab Investment Company
Post Content:
تعلن الشركة العربية للاستثمار عن تعيين الأستاذ دخيل الزهراني، الرئيس التنفيذي للاستثمار. في هذا الدور، سيشرف الأستاذ دخيل على جميع الأنشطة المتعلقة بالاستثمار وإدارة المحافظ.بخبرة تزيد عن 25 عامًا في الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول، شغل الأستاذ دخيل مناصب قيادية في عدد من الشركات والمؤسسات في القطاعات المختلفة. تمتد خبرته إلى الاستثمار الاستراتيجي وإدارة الأصول والاستثمار في الأسهم الخاصة، وعمليات الاندماج والاستحواذ، والتمويل المؤسسي في منطقة الشرق الأوسط وشمال إفريقيا. وهو يتمتع بمعرفة عميقة في تقييم فرص الأعمال والاستثمار، وتطوير الخطط الاستراتيجية والتشغيلية، وخبرة في تقييم الاستثمارات، وتحليل ونمذجة المعلومات المالية.The Arab Investment Company announces the appointment of Mr. Dakheel Al Zahrani as Chief Investment Officer. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

𝐂𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐍𝐨. 34 𝐨𝐟 2025 – 𝐀 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐑𝐨𝐮𝐭𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐋𝐏𝐬 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐔𝐀𝐄 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐚𝐱?The Decision released this weekend introduces a comprehensive new framework for Qualifying Limited Partnerships (QLPs). For some structures, this could offer an alternative path to tax exemption—even if they fail to meet the conditions for a Qualifying Investment Fund (QIF).This is a particularly relevant question for ADGM and DIFC Limited Partnerships holding an investment fund license but falling short of QIF requirements—most often due to ownership concentration thresholds.👉 In the article, we explore how the QLP regime may serve as a fallback exemption route in these cases.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#LimitedPartnership hashtag#InvestmentFunds hashtag#TaxExemption hashtag#ADGM hashtag#DIFC hashtag#QIF hashtag#QLP hashtag#FundStructuring hashtag#WealthManagement hashtag#PrivateEquity hashtag#VentureCapital

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mall—and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access – no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout – zero friction.Trade-in machines – seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation – onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations – shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration – loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recently—and how close are our retail properties to catching up? Phil McArthur, CRX, CSM, CDPMcARTHUR Retail Development SpecialistsThe Dubai MallMeghan McArthur, BASc.e& UAEMisba MithwaniArem Libuton

Post Content:
خلال أسبوعين او أكثر قليلاً سيتم البدء في الدورة السادسة التي تقيمها آبكس للتأهيل لعضوية RICS عبر مسار Senior Professional Assessment (SPA) . هذا المسار المعد خصيصاً للمستويات القيادية و موظفي الإدارة العليا و مديري الإدارات في الشركات العاملة في مجالات صناعة التشييد و الاستشارات و التطوير العقاري و إدارة المشروعات .. بالإضافة إلي المؤثرين و رواد الأعمال و مؤسسي الشركات الصغيرة و متناهية الصغر ..قدمت آبكس و خلال ثلاث سنوات هذا البرنامج المتكامل للعاملين QS & Construction Sector Pathway للناشطين في وظائف ( Commercial , Controls, Contracts , Technical Office, Quantity Surveying, Cost control , Procurement, Tendering, .. ) ..بالإضافة إلي Project Management Sector Pathway للزملاء للناشطين في وظائف  ( Planning, Programming, PMO, Scheduling , Controls, ... ) ..فإذا كنت راغباً في خوض هذه التجربة الممتعة و تحققت فيك الاشتراطات اللازمة لهذا التحدي الرائع .. تواصل مع ممثلي آبكس عبر تطبيق الواتس آب و من أي مكان في العالم عبر هذا الرقم 201097794137+hashtag#ApexExperts hashtag#MRICS hashtag#SPAroutehashtag#SeniorProfessionalshashtag#MentorshipInArabichashtag#RICSJourneyhashtag#LeadershipToMembership
